level.text: The purpose of the Partnership Program for Affordable Housing is to work, in partnership with private sector for profit and non-profit owners, to protect and increase the supply of affordable housing in the District of Columbia, particularly:
In properties requiring rehabilitation as a result of significant code violations;
In neighborhoods where affordable housing is not readily available;
Where subsidies are needed to reduce displacement as a result of gentrification;
For low income disabled families requiring accessible or supportive living environments;
For elderly families requiring accessible or supportive living environments; and

Of units, located in poverty impacted neighborhoods, undergoing substantial rehabilitation as part of a comprehensive neighborhood revitalization strategy in which subsidies are required to reduce displacement or increase levels of affordability.
